column4: you can't go through 2 subnet masks like that, what king of routers are they
I'm using my adsl modem which doubles as a router and then that connects to another router which all the computers run off.
yeah thats a tricky one, does your isp you ppoa or what, you need to change the modem mode to bridge mode
then have the router do that authentication, but your router might not be able to do it
ivc, the Wan type is PPPoA LLC
will you router be able to do that kind of authentication?
I'm pretty sure it can.
what kind of router?
the router the computers are connected to is a DLink DI-624
whats the command I would use? I know the external facing Ip of the router, what would me the line i use?
oh well i don't know about that, go into the web interface for you modem, change it to bridge mode, then go into router and switch the authentication to ppoa and enter passwort
you need to mess with router/modem, not clients
what would be the command  to connect if I was just connected to the modem?
if is usually a web address
jowi, it is a possibility to connect just through the one router, how would I do that using "ssh" the options I'd have to use?
jowi, is it using -L?
networking isn't easy, read this http://www.aboutdebian.com/network.htm and then you'll have a rough idea
